intro: Euphrasia daisenensis, commonly known as the Daisen eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. It has hairy, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Euphrasia daisenensis is valued for its medicinal properties and is often used in traditional herbal remedies.
